subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Awe: The Emotion Science and Religion Share
description: A micro-lesson that makes Awe: The Emotion Science and Religion Share usable.

hook.text: A sunset, a galaxy, a newborn. Awe is the one emotion both science and religion produce equally. It might unite them.

buildup.text: Psychologist Dacher Keltner's research shows awe is a distinct emotion that reduces self-focus and increases generosity.

discovery.text: Scientists feel awe discovering a new particle. Monks feel it in meditation. The emotion is identical in both brains.

twist.text: Awe may be the common root of science and religion. Both started when humans looked at the sky and felt overwhelmed.

climax.text: Instead of debating who's right, science and religion could bond over shared wonder. Awe transcends the argument.

punchline.text: Awe is the shared root. Science and religion both began by looking up.

quiz.question: What is unique about the emotion of awe?
options: It's felt equally by scientists and religious practitioners
